title: Creating a Common Denominator
text: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of $$n^2-3n-10$$ and $$n^2+5n+6$$ is $$\left(n+2\right) \left(n-5\right) \left(n+3\right)$$
speech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of  n squared minus 3 n minus 10  and  n squared, plus 5 n plus 6  is  parentheses n plus 2,  times, parentheses n minus 5,  times, parentheses n plus 3,
pacedSpeech: We must find the LCD in order to be able to add the fractions. The LCM of   n squared minus 3 n minus 10
and   n squared, plus 5 n plus 6
is    n plus 2,  times,  n minus 5,  times,  n plus 3,

title: Rewriting Each Fraction
text: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get $$\frac{2n\left(n+3\right)}{\left(n+2\right) \left(n-5\right) \left(n+3\right)}$$ + $$\frac{6\left(n-5\right)}{\left(n+2\right) \left(n-5\right) \left(n+3\right)}$$
speech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get  fraction, 2 n, parentheses n plus 3, , over, parentheses n plus 2,  times, parentheses n minus 5,  times, parentheses n plus 3, ,   +  fraction, 6 times, parentheses n minus 5, , over, parentheses n plus 2,  times, parentheses n minus 5,  times, parentheses n plus 3, ,
pacedSpeech: We can rewrite each fraction with a common scaler to get   fraction, 2 n,  n plus 3, , over,  n plus 2,  times,  n minus 5,  times,  n plus 3, ,
+   fraction, 6 times,  n minus 5, , over,  n plus 2,  times,  n minus 5,  times,  n plus 3, ,

title: Adding the Fractions
speech: Adding the fractions, we get  fraction, 2 n squared, plus 12 n minus 30, over, parentheses n plus 2,  times, parentheses n minus 5,  times, parentheses n plus 3, ,
pacedSpeech: Adding the fractions, we get   fraction, 2 n squared, plus 12 n minus 30, over,  n plus 2,  times,  n minus 5,  times,  n plus 3, ,
